GUIEngine

Class GUIMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • GUIEngine.GUIMain

  • public class GUIMain
extends javafx.application.Application
    The Main class that coordinates the GUI objects, GUI pages and the linking between the GUI and the backend.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    adsrc, brihijoshi

    • Method Detail

      • addOrbAndAnimate

        public static void addOrbAndAnimate(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane root,
                                    int row,
                                    int column,
                                    int numSpheres,
                                    javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        This function is used to add specified number of spheres to the cell, of the specified color. Given a row, column this function adds specified number of Sphere objects to the StackPane at the specified position and animates them for rotation. Here, we decide the size of the spheres to be added depending upon the size of the GUI grid.
        Parameters:
        root - GridPane that represents the GUI grid
        row - row number to which we have to add
        column - column number to which we have to add
        numSpheres - number of spheres that we have to add
        color - Color object denoting the color the new spheres have to be

      • changeGridColor

        public static void changeGridColor(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid,
                                   javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Changes the color of the GridPane grid to the given Color
        Parameters:
        grid - the GridPane to be changed
        color - the Color to which the grid has to change

      • checkEndGame

        public static boolean checkEndGame()
        Checks for the end game condition It iterates over the player ArrayList and returns whether the number of players having their _isAlive attribute set to true is 1 or not. If it is 1, it means game has ended.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if end-game condition is reached

        Parameters:

        g - Grid object to be used as source

      • setEmptyGrid

        public static javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane setEmptyGrid(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane root,
                                                          int numRows,
                                                          int numColumns,
                                                          javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        A function that creates an empty grid for the start page. The GridPane root is the GUI Grid where the game takes place. Each index of the GridPane has a StackPane which again contains a Group. The StackPane color is changed to the parameter color. According to the size of the GridPane, its RowConstraints and ColumnConstraints are decided.The redoButton and the MenuBar is also created.
        Parameters:
        root - a GridPane GUI Grid where the game takes place
        numRows - an Integer denoting the number of rows in the grid
        numColumns - an Integer denoting the number of column in the grid
        color - a Color object which is used to set the color of the StackPane
        Returns:
        a BorderPane object that contains the GridPane, the Buttons and the MenuBar

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the main Start method of the application which is launched when the application is clicked on. It initializes the _gameEngine for the GUIMain class with the defaault number of players and grid size. It is also responsible for initializing the ArrayList of ColorPicker objects.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - Primary Stage of the application
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - In case of serialization errors
